title: Dominica - Conflict Data
org: Armed Conflict Location & Event Data Project (ACLED)

bites.title: Map of locations
bite: On 18 August 2020, in Layou, Saint Joseph, residents protested for the second day in a row against the dredging of the river in their community, which affects the ecosystem and their livelihoods. The residents placed boats and fishing nets at the entry to the waterway so that dredging boats could not access it. [size=no report]

On 17 August 2020, in Layou, Saint Joseph, residents protested against the dredging of the river in their community, which affects the ecosystem and their livelihoods. The residents placed boats and fishing nets at the entry to the waterway so that dredging boats could not access it. [size=no report]

On 14 August 2020, in Canefield, Saint Paul, protesters of the Concerned Citizens Movement gathered at the residence of the country's president to protest against a number of perceived economic injustices including the minimum wage, high unemployment rates and the money spent on the upkeep of the residence. [size=no report]

On 25 May 2020, in Portsmouth, Saint John, bus drivers gathered in protest out of dissatisfaction with a loan scheme that the government provided as a form of relief for those hit economically by coronavirus. [size=no report]
On 28 March 2020, throughout Dominica a curfew was imposed to prevent the spread of coronavirus.
On 07 January 2020 in Petite Savanne outside Berekua, a handful of parents protested the bad condition of the building housing the primary school. [size=a handful]
On 13 December 2019 in Marigot, streets were blocked with barricades, demonstrators blocked a bridge, burned tires and cars and threw projectiles at police. [size=no report]

On 12 December 2019 in Marigot, demonstrators blocked roads and paralyzed traffic, against the State_ natural risk prevention plan PPRN. Gendarmes in riot gear pulled down barricades and doused garbage bin fires to unblock main roads while firing tear gas cannisters to disperse demonstrators, who threw rocks at police. [size=no report]
On 05 December 2019 in Canefield outside Roseau, the highway was blocked by protesters who expressing their dissatisfaction over the non-implementation of electoral reform. [size=no report]

On 05 December 2019 in Salisbury, during demonstrations for electoral reform where demonstrators put up barricades, two people were shot and injured as police fired at a crowd of demonstrators. One of those injured was a 14-year-old Haitian boy. Police, accompanied by special forces from Barbados, also sprayed teargas at demonstrators throughout the village. [size=no report]

On 05 December 2019 in Marigot, about 150 protesters, mostly teachers, marched in solidarity with the national protest over the French proposed pension reform. In addition, many more teachers and school employees are reported to have been on strike from work. [size=about 150]

On 04 December 2019 in Marigot, demonstrators demanded electoral reforms to ensure free and fair elections. They blocked roads with burning debris, blocking access to the university and the main airport. [size=no report]

On 03 December 2019 in Marigot, demonstrators demanded electoral reform before the December 6 elections. Residents in the area blocked roads and burnt tires, with reports of police setting up barricades, firing teargas and bullets at demonstrators. [size=no report]

On 18 November 2019 in Roseau, over 200 people connected with opposition party UWP participated in an electoral reform demonstration where some demonstrators were uprooting plants, blocking roads, burning garbage, spreading garbage on the streets, and removing police barricades. The UWP leader on November 19 condemned the police for clashing with demonstrators and spraying tear gas and shooting rubber bullets at them. [size=more than 200]

On 15 November 2019 in Roseau, a group of protesters demanding electoral reform spent the whole night outside protesting, close to police barricades that had been set up to prevent them access to the Government Headquarters and Financial Centre. [size=no report]
On 14 November 2019 in Roseau, a number of police officers, many of them dressed in black, marched through the streets protesting over their dissatisfaction with salary negotiations. [size=no report]

On November 11, 2019, in Roseau, a dozen protesters staged a peaceful protest against electoral reform outside the President_ Palace. A lawyer who participated in the protest was reported to have been physically assaulted by a senior police officer. [size=a dozen]
On September 30, 2019, in Roseau, there were protests organized by the opposition United Workers Party (UWP) demanding accountability from the Prime Minister. [size=no report]
On September 27, 2019, in Roseau, there was a climate strike inspired by the _ridays For Future_movement. [size=no report]
On August 23, 2019, in St Joseph, residents gathered to protest the government_ investments and budget. [size=a group]
On August 22, 2019, in Roseau, protesters gathered to protest the government_ investments and budget. [size=no report]
On August 22, 2019, in Portsmouth, protesters gathered to protest the government_ investments and budget. [size=no report]

On June 17, 2019, in Berekua, Saint Patrick, residents of Pichelin staged a demonstration to complain about the candidate running for the Dominica Labor Party and demanded that she needed to decline her candidacy to let a new face run for the general election. [size=no report]
On April 1 2019, dozens of people protested in the city of Marigot, Saint Andrew, Dominica, to demand for better health services. [size=unknown]
On February 13 2019, a citizen of Saint Vincent and the Grenadines was shot and killed in Marigot, Dominica, by police officers associated with customs.
Around 19 December 2018 (as reported), in Marigot, Saint Andrew, residents protested over the lack of a functioning hospital in their community. [size=no report]

On 15 December 2018, in Roseau, Saint George, the CCM: Concerned Citizens Movement organized a protest outside the office of the Electoral Office. The crowd started blocking the road after which police used tear gas to disperse the crowd. Protested later complained that the use of tear gas was excessive and that even children were affected. [size=no report]

On 22 November 2018, in Roseau, Saint George, a number of people and UWP supporters showed up outside the courthouse to protest against the ongoing case against members of the opposition party UWP, which they claim is a politically motivated case. The group later became a procession which moved to the police station while chanting. [size=no report]
On 30 October 2018, workers of Petit-Coulibri protested in Sufriere against the blockage of a road by a diversion made on the interest of a private land.

Around 21 October 2018 (as reported), in Saint John Parish, Saint John, a small group of people stood at the site of a concrete plant under construction to protest against the building of this plant, as it would have adverse effects on human and animal life. [size=no report]
On 25 September 2018, in Portsmouth, Saint John, students marched in a demonstration to raise awareness for dementia and Altzheimer. [size=no report]
On 20 September 2018, in Roseau, Saint George, the Concerned Citizens Movement organized a protest outside the Parliament building over several proposed electoral reform measures. [size=no report]

On 19 September 2018, in Roseau, Saint George, protesters affiliated with UWP gathered outside the court house where an obstruction of justice trial was being held against three politicians of the UWP party. [size=no report]
DFP: Dominica Freedom Party; UWP: United Workers Party

On 25 June 2018, in Roseau, Saint George, supporters of the opposition parties DFP and UWP protested outside the parliament in Roseau against an Anti-Terrorism Bill that is being discussed. [size=no report]
On 17 April 2018, in Roseau, Saint George, attorneys marched to demand improvements in the conditions of the courts that have not been repaired since the hurricane Maria. [size=no report]
On 16 January 2018, in Roseau, Saint George, residents from the neighborhood Stock Farm blocked the roads to protest against the dumping of waste materials in a former landfill. [size=no report]

bites.bite: The largest admin1 is Saint George with 16 reports followed by Saint Andrew with 8 reports.
The largest admin1 is Saint George with 16 reports followed by Saint Andrew with 8 reports.
